channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned sweeper’s bag, Victoria Way, 11th November
item.description:
Flytipping is lazy and criminal, so can this bag of rubbish that’s been here since at least Friday in a known flytipping hotspot be dealt with before it attracts more dumping?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Way, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed, No MOT, Not Road Worthy, 11th November
item.description:
Vehicle has been on the side of the road across from Thomas A Becket primary school for the past few months; its now up on blocks, no rear wheels, no headlights, and the door to the rear is broken. We've got enough problems with people breaking into cars down here already and don't more abandoned vehicles to attract more vehicle broken into.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mottisfont Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress at tree, 11th November
item.description:
Mattress and other rubbish dumped at tree

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Voi e-bikes are all over the sidewalk, currently 4 of them, 11th November
item.description:
There should be no e-bikes parked outside of the designated area. Since Hackney council made a deal with Voi, things have become much worse, in many places there is a huge overflow of both green and Voi e-bikes - on the pavements and roads

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defaced Parking Restriction signage, 11th November
item.description:

item.title: Street light not working near 5 Havelock Road, 11th November
item.description:
I did report this last week but looks like the light is out again: FixMyStreet ref: 8372212. The light on the street light near No.5-7 Havelock Road, Bromley BR2 9NY is not working. Given it gets darker earlier heading towards winter it will be great to get the light fixed please. Thank you! Asset ID: 83-H-6
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havelock Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous fly-tipping, 11th November

item.title: Rocking badly and noisily, 11th November
item.description:
The manhole cover has two parts and both seem to be dropping. They are in part below road surface. It is in a bus lane and sooner or later the metal plates will give way and the bus could be stuck.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Camden Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights not working, 11th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norman Road, Lower Belvedere, London
